summary: <summary>   <purpose>The pathUtils.ts file provides a set of utility functions for working with file paths in a Node.js environment. It offers methods for normalizing, getting relative and absolute paths, validating paths, retrieving file extensions, and generating display-friendly paths.</purpose>   <key_components>     - PathUtils class     - normalize(filepath: string): string     - getRelativePath(filepath: string, rootDir: string): string     - getAbsolutePath(filepath: string, rootDir: string): string     - validatePath(filepath: string): boolean     - getExtension(filepath: string): string     - getBaseName(filepath: string): string     - join(...paths: string[]): string     - createDisplayPath(filepath: string, maxLength: number = 50): string     - FileSystemError   </key_components>   <dependencies>     - path (Node.js built-in module)     - fs (Node.js built-in module)     - customErrors.ts (custom error module)   </dependencies>   <unique_characteristics>     - Utilizes path.relative(), path.resolve(), and path.extname() to perform path operations     - Throws FileSystemError for invalid paths     - Provides a createDisplayPath() function to generate a truncated path for display purposes   </unique_characteristics>   <methods>     - normalize     - getRelativePath     - getAbsolutePath     - validatePath     - getExtension     - getBaseName     - join     - createDisplayPath   </methods>   <exports if any>     - PathUtils class   </exports if any> </summary>
